title: How to Make Vegan Tiramisu

steps.headline: Dissolve the cornflour in a small saucepan with a little bit of soy milk.
steps.description: Then add the remaining soy milk and bring it to the boil. Stir constantly.

steps.headline: Remove from the heat after cooking the cornflour and soy milk for 10 to 20 seconds more.
steps.description: Place this mixture in the fridge to cool.

steps.headline: Mix the coffee and the Amaretto together.
Dip the sponge fingers in the coffee mix one by one.
steps.description: Arrange the coffee-dipped biscuits across the base of the serving dish.

steps.headline: Remove the well-chilled cornflour and soy milk mixture from the fridge.
steps.description: Add the margarine, vanilla sugar and soy cream.

steps.headline: Beat with an electric beater until the cream mixture becomes smooth and velvety.
steps.description: If you don't have an electric beater, it can be whisked by hand but it will take you longer before it becomes smooth enough.

steps.headline: Pour the velvety cream over the coffee-soaked sponge fingers.
Sprinkle with the grated dark chocolate across the top of the tiramisu dish.
steps.description: Berries can also be added to enhance the appearance and flavour.

steps.headline: Place in the refrigerator to cool until ready to serve.

text: Dissolve the cornflour in a small saucepan with a little bit of soy milk. Then add the remaining soy milk and bring it to the boil. Stir constantly. Remove from the heat after cooking the cornflour and soy milk for 10 to 20 seconds more. Place this mixture in the fridge to cool. Mix the coffee and the Amaretto together.  Dip the sponge fingers in the coffee mix one by one. Arrange the coffee-dipped biscuits across the base of the serving dish. Remove the well-chilled cornflour and soy milk mixture from the fridge. Add the margarine, vanilla sugar and soy cream. Beat with an electric beater until the cream mixture becomes smooth and velvety. If you don't have an electric beater, it can be whisked by hand but it will take you longer before it becomes smooth enough. Pour the velvety cream over the coffee-soaked sponge fingers. Spread across evenly. Sprinkle with the grated dark chocolate across the top of the tiramisu dish. Berries can also be added to enhance the appearance and flavour. Place in the refrigerator to cool until ready to serve.
